title: Slide Inner - Usage Examples
description: Child slide container for tp-anything-carousel. Each slide holds custom content blocks.

examples.name: Simple Image Slide
examples.visualDescription: Centered product image with white background, clean presentation
notes: key='0' matches carouselList[0]._key in parent carousel
itemId is unique identifier for this specific slide instance
Parent carousel controls transitions, this block just holds content

examples.name: Hero Slide with Full Layout
examples.description: Full-width hero banner slide with heading, text, and CTA
examples.visualDescription: Full-width hero section with gradient background, large white heading, paragraph, and prominent button
examples.useCase: Hero carousels, banner rotations, homepage headers
notes: key='1' for second slide in carousel
Use tp-container for full-width backgrounds
Ensure content works well with carousel fade/slide transitions
Keep text concise (users may skip slides quickly)

examples.name: Testimonial Slide
examples.description: Customer testimonial card with quote and avatar
examples.visualDescription: White card with customer quote in italics, 5-star rating, customer name and company, circular avatar photo
childContent: tp-container (white background, padding, border radius, shadow)
examples.useCase: Testimonial carousels, client reviews, case studies
notes: Parent carousel typically has tpgbEqualHeight=true for testimonials
Use consistent padding/margins across all testimonial slides
Keep quotes to 2-3 sentences for readability
Avatar images should be same dimensions (square, e.g., 200x200px)

examples.name: Product Card Slide
examples.description: E-commerce product card with image, title, price, rating
examples.visualDescription: Product image on white background, product title below, price in purple, 4.5-star rating, 'Add to Cart' button
childContent: tp-container (white background, border, hover shadow transition)
examples.useCase: Product carousels, featured products, upsells, related items
notes: Parent carousel often uses OverflowHid=true for clean edges
Use equal height (parent: tpgbEqualHeight=true) for uniform card sizing
Product images should be same aspect ratio (square recommended)
Consider lazy loading for product images (performance)

examples.name: Blog Post Slide
examples.description: Blog post card with featured image, title, excerpt, read more
examples.visualDescription: Featured image at top, blog title in bold, 2-line excerpt preview, 'Read More' link in purple
examples.useCase: Blog carousels, news feeds, article showcases
notes: Use line clamping for title (2 lines) and excerpt (3 lines) for equal height
Parent carousel: tpgbEqualHeight=true + equalUnqClass='blog-carousel'
Featured images must be same aspect ratio (16:9 recommended)
Keep excerpts to 120-150 characters max

examples.name: Feature Highlight Slide
examples.description: Service/feature card with icon, heading, description
examples.visualDescription: Purple gradient background, white FontAwesome icon (64px), white heading, white description text, centered alignment
examples.useCase: Feature showcases, service highlights, capability overviews
notes: Parent carousel may use rmdOrder=true for randomized features
Use consistent icon sizes across all feature slides
Keep descriptions to 1-2 sentences
Ensure sufficient contrast (white text on dark/purple backgrounds)

examples.name: Team Member Slide
examples.description: Team member card with photo, name, role, social links
examples.visualDescription: Team member photo (grayscale), name below in bold, role in gray, social media icon links (LinkedIn, Twitter)
childContent: tp-container (white background, border radius, hover effect)
examples.useCase: Team carousels, leadership showcases, staff directories
notes: Parent carousel: tpgbEqualHeight=true for consistent card heights
All headshots should be same dimensions and style (color vs grayscale)
Consider hover effect revealing bio or additional info
Social icons should be consistent size (24-32px)

examples.name: Complex Slide with Template Content
examples.description: Slide loading content from WordPress block template
examples.visualDescription: Content loaded from saved template, could be any layout defined in WordPress
childContent: Content loaded from saved WordPress block template/pattern
Template ID defined in parent's carouselList[7].blockTemp
examples.useCase: Reusable slide layouts, CMS-managed content, multi-site carousels
notes: Parent carousel must have caroslideType='template'
Parent's carouselList item must have contentType='template' and blockTemp='template-id'
tp-anything-slide just holds the template content
Template can be edited separately and updates all instances

keyPattern.description: The 'key' attribute must match parent carousel's carouselList._key
keyPattern.example: Parent has carouselList: [{_key: '0'}, {_key: '1'}, {_key: '2'}], slides have key: '0', '1', '2'
keyPattern.important: Keys must be sequential strings (0, 1, 2...) for proper carousel functionality

itemIdPattern.description: Unique identifier for this slide instance
itemIdPattern.important: Must be unique across all slides in carousel

contentStructure.complex: Container → Row → Multiple columns with various blocks
contentStructure.template: Content loaded from saved WordPress template

parentChildRelationship.parent: tp-anything-carousel controls carousel settings, transitions, navigation
parentChildRelationship.child: tp-anything-slide is just a content container, no carousel logic
parentChildRelationship.communication: Parent's carouselList[n]._key must match child's key attribute
parentChildRelationship.count: Number of slides = number of items in parent's carouselList array

validationRules.key: Required, must be string matching parent's carouselList._key (use '0', '1', '2'...)
validationRules.itemId: Optional but recommended, must be unique string identifier
validationRules.parentRequired: MUST be child of tpgb/tp-anything-carousel block

warnings: CRITICAL: key must match parent carousel's carouselList[n]._key exactly
CRITICAL: Must be direct child of tp-anything-carousel block (won't work standalone)
itemId should be unique across all slides (prevents ID conflicts)
Don't use duplicate keys (causes carousel to malfunction)
Parent carousel must exist before adding slides
Number of tp-anything-slide blocks should match parent's carouselList length
Deleting slide doesn't auto-update parent's carouselList (manual cleanup needed)
Heavy content in slides (videos, large images) impacts carousel performance
Slide content should work well with parent's transition type (fade vs slide)
Parent's tpgbEqualHeight affects ALL slides (ensure consistent content structure)
commonMistakes: Setting key that doesn't exist in parent's carouselList (slide won't appear)
Using number for key instead of string (use '0', not 0)
Creating tp-anything-slide without parent carousel (block won't work)
Forgetting to update key after duplicating slide (causes duplicate key errors)
Using itemId that's not unique (ID conflicts in HTML)
Adding more slides than carouselList items in parent (extra slides won't render)
Not keeping content consistent across slides when parent has tpgbEqualHeight=true
Using auto-playing videos in slides (conflicts with carousel transitions)
Overloading slides with content (keep it concise for carousel context)
Forgetting that parent controls all carousel behavior (can't change from child)
bestPractices: Always use sequential string keys ('0', '1', '2', '3'...) for clarity
Keep slide content concise (users may skip slides quickly in carousel)
Use consistent content structure across all slides (helps with equal height)
Wrap content in tp-container for backgrounds, padding, and styling
Use tp-row and tp-column for responsive layouts
Optimize images for web (WebP format, appropriate dimensions)
Keep text readable (sufficient size, contrast, line height)
Ensure interactive elements (buttons, links) are touch-friendly on mobile
Test slides with different content lengths to verify equal height behavior
Don't nest carousels (carousel inside carousel causes issues)
Use template mode (parent: caroslideType='template') for reusable slide layouts
Coordinate with parent carousel settings (transition type, equal height, etc.)
For hero slides, use tp-container with full-width backgrounds
For card-based slides (products, testimonials), use consistent padding and borders
Limit text to 2-3 lines for headings, 3-4 lines for paragraphs
Use lazy loading for images (especially in product carousels)
Test on mobile devices (slide content must be readable on small screens)

singleImage.notes: Ensure images same aspect ratio for clean carousel

heroLayout.structure: tp-container (full-width bg) → tp-row → tp-column → heading + paragraph + button
heroLayout.notes: Use fade transition (parent: carType='fade') for smooth effect

cardLayout.structure: tp-container (card styling) → tp-row → tp-column → content blocks
cardLayout.notes: Parent should have tpgbEqualHeight=true for uniform cards

twoColumnSlide.useCase: Feature comparisons, before/after, image + text combos
twoColumnSlide.notes: Ensure columns stack properly on mobile

centeredContent.structure: tp-container (centered) → tp-row → tp-column (centered) → icon + heading + text

accessibilityNotes: Use semantic headings in slide content (h2, h3, h4 in proper hierarchy)
Ensure sufficient color contrast (WCAG 2.1 AA: 4.5:1 for text, 3:1 for large text)
Provide alt text for all images in slides
Make buttons/links keyboard accessible (proper focus states)
Don't rely solely on color to convey information
Ensure text is readable (minimum 16px for body text)
Test with screen readers (ensure content is announced in logical order)
Avoid text over images without sufficient contrast or overlay
Use descriptive link text ('Learn More About Our Services', not 'Click Here')
Ensure carousel navigation is keyboard accessible (parent tp-carousel-remote)
Don't auto-advance slides (user should control navigation)
Provide clear indication of which slide is active
Ensure touch targets are at least 44x44px on mobile
performanceConsiderations: Lazy load images in slides (especially important for carousels with many slides)
Optimize images (WebP format, correct dimensions, compressed)
Avoid auto-playing videos in slides (heavy on resources)
Keep slide content lightweight (avoid embedding large iframes, maps)
Use CSS animations instead of JavaScript where possible
Limit number of slides to 20 or fewer (parent validation)
Test on mobile devices (carousels can be resource-intensive)
Consider using template mode for large-scale carousels (better caching)
Avoid heavy fonts or too many font variations in slides
Monitor cumulative layout shift (CLS) when slides load
